channel.title: Settings for hosting
channel.description: Hey ppl, im new and i dont know how to make settings to host. I keep messing up. And i port forwarded. If u can help plz.

item.title: Settings for hosting
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

You dont need to change any Ip’s aslong as you tell people or sites your IP and you have your server running people can play. For added security get a dns-redirect from www.no-ip.com. You need to remember than when the host (you) connects to the server the IP will always be localhost/127.0.0.1

To find out your IP go onto www.ipchicken.com

Read full topic

item.title: Settings for hosting
item.dc:creator: @Xaros Xaros
item.description:
@Xaros wrote:

No… I am saying do i need to edit some localhosts to IPs.

Read full topic

item.title: Settings for hosting
item.dc:creator: @Cronic123 Cronic123
item.description:
@Cronic123 wrote:

If your saying that your client connects to localhost everytime on your client then just go in the egui file of your client search 127.0.0.1 and change it to your ip every tim it comes up

Read full topic

item.title: Settings for hosting
item.dc:creator: @Xaros Xaros
item.description:
@Xaros wrote:

I did all of that. What i really need, is to know what files to edit. To make the server.
I mean the files that set the IP to login u know. To host. Or do i host on localhost?

Read full topic

item.title: Settings for hosting
item.dc:creator: @Cronic123 Cronic123
item.description:
@Cronic123 wrote:

The way i do it is: Download JDK, Download Source, Make a no-ip,Download No-ip DUC, Set enviromental Variables, Open Port 43594 or 5555, Then Port Forward if have a router, then runserver(you might have to open no-ip DUC before you run server)
hope that helps

Read full topic
